result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke Steven Rauseo-Jasperson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Luke Steven Rauseo-Jasperson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Luke Steven Rauseo-Jasperson was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Court notes 198 days credit against any ultimate sentence.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to continue with his mental health treatment including taking medication as prescribed and keep appointments.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Defendant to complete his HSED.
-Defendant to participate in MRT or some sort of cognitive programming.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Programming Client Evaluation. SEALED. km
Signed by Def and Atty. km
Sentencing hearing on October 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

**AMENDED**

- Follow all directives of the programming. 

- Participate in a mental health evaluation and any recommended follow through. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- DE to make all his appts. with his agent.

- AODA and any recommended follow through

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex. 

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Karissa C. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Luke Steven Rauseo-Jasperson appeared. Case called at 3:51. ADA Minser updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 1 to a class F felony <3 grams 961.41 (1)(e)1 removing the repeater in 15CF451. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court finds the DE clearly competent. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 to a Class F felony <3 grams  in 15CF451. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses  repeater inhancer in Ct. 1 and Ct 3 in 15CF451. Court orders a PSI. DE physical address is 611 S. Main #6 Cameron, WI 54822. Mailing address remains the same. DE has successfully discharged from treatment. Court recieves discharge summary and have it sealed in the court file.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser. Investigator Jim Mikla. DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz and DF ATTY: Joe Caton DF: Karissa Marie Clausen appeared. DF: Luke Steven Rauseo-Jasperson. Case called at 11:34. Includes 15CF450, 15CF451. S/T Investigator Jim Mikla. Direct by ADA Minser. Investigator Mikla identifies DE Luke Rauseo-Jasperson and DE Karissa Clausen in court. Cross by Atty. Schlitz. Cross by Atty. Caton. Court questions Investigator Mikla. Redirect by ADA Minser. Recross by Atty. Schlitz.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed on 15CF450 and 15CF451 and the DF's probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Address confirmed. Atty. Schlitz questions the hold on the car and it's contents. Court would like Atty. Schlitz and ADA Minser to stipulate on the release of the car and certain contents.  Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.
